SEARCH
Module flag4j
Package org.flag4j.algebraic_structures.rings

Interface Ring<T extends Ring<T>>

Type Parameters:
T - Type of the ring element.
All Superinterfaces:
Semiring<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
Field<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
Complex128, Complex64, RealFloat32, RealFloat64, RealInt16, RealInt32
public interface Ring<T extends Ring<T>> extends Semiring<T>

This interface specifies a mathematical ring. This interface not only meets the basic definition of a ring, but also specifies some additional operations which are common and useful.

Ring elements should be immutable.

Formally, an ring is a set R with the binary operations addition (+) and multiplication (*) defined such that for elements a, b, c in R the following are satisfied:

  • Addition and multiplication are associative: a + (b + c) = (a + b) + c and a * (b * c) = (a * b) * c.
  • Addition is commutative: a + b = b + a
  • Existence of additive and multiplicative identities: There exists two distinct elements 0 and 1 in R such that a + 0 = 0 and a * 1 = 1 (called the additive and multiplicative identities respectively).
  • Existence of additive inverse: There exists an element -a in R such that a + (-a) = 0.
  • Distributivity of multiplication over addition: a * (b + c) = (a * b) + (a * c).

Rings generalize fields in that multiplication need not be commutative and multiplicative inverses need not exists. As a result, division is not defined for a ring.

      Computes the addative inverse for an element of this ring.

      An element -x is an addative inverse for a filed element x if -x + x = 0 where 0 is the addative identity..

      The additive inverse for this ring element.
